# Install and load required packages
```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
if (!require(haven)) install.packages("haven")

if (!require(DescTools)) install.packages("DescTools")
library(DescTools)
```

# Load data
```{r}
## Load net sample data set
load("df.RData")

## Load gross sample data set (only available directly from LISS staff - not in public LISS repository)
df_gross1 <- read_sav("Sample_split1_202401.sav") 
df_gross2 <- read_sav("Sample_split2_202403.sav")
```

# Merge data
```{r}
## Two gross samples
df_gross <- rbind(df_gross1, df_gross2)

## Add indicator variables for net sample
df <- df %>% 
  mutate(net = 1)

## Merge gross and net sample
df_gross <- merge(df_gross, df, by="nomem_encr", all.x = T)
```

# Recoding 
```{r echo=FALSE}
## Create variable in gross sample for net sample
df_gross <- df_gross %>% 
  mutate(net = factor(case_when(net == 1 ~ "Yes",
                                .default = "No"),
                      levels = c("Yes", "No")))

summary(df_gross$net)

## Gender
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(gender = factor(
    case_when((geslacht == 1) ~ "Male",
              (geslacht == 2) ~ "Female",
              (geslacht == 3) ~ "Other"
    ),
    levels = c("Female", "Male", "Other")
  ))
summary(df_gross$gender)

## Age
summary(df_gross$gebjaar)
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(age = as.numeric(2023 - gebjaar))
summary(df_gross$age)
hist(df_gross$age)

df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(age_groups = factor(
    case_when((age < 55) ~ "50-54 years",
              (age >= 55 &
                 age < 60) ~ "55-59 years",
              (age >= 60 &
                 age < 65) ~ "60-64 years",
              (age >= 65 &
                 age < 70) ~ "65-69 years",
              (age >= 70 &
                 age < 75) ~ "70-74 years",
              (age >= 75 &
                 age < 80) ~ "75-79 years",
              (age >= 80) ~ "80 years or older"
    )
  ))
summary(df_gross$age_groups)

## HH size
summary(df_gross$aantalhh)
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(hh_size = factor(
    case_when((aantalhh == 1) ~ "One person HH",
              (aantalhh == 2) ~ "Two person HH",
              (aantalhh > 2) ~ "Three and more person HH"
    ),
    levels = c("One person HH", "Two person HH",
               "Three and more person HH")
  ))
summary(df_gross$hh_size)

## Urabnicity
summary(df_gross$sted)
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(urban = factor(
    case_when((sted == 1) ~ "Very strongly urban",
              (sted == 2) ~ "Strongly urban",
              (sted == 3) ~ "Moderately urban",
              (sted == 4) ~ "Little urban",
              (sted == 5) ~ "Not urban",
              .default = NA
    ),
    levels = c(
      "Not urban",
      "Little urban",
      "Moderately urban",
      "Strongly urban",
      "Very strongly urban"
    )
  ))
summary(df_gross$urban)

## Employment status
summary(df_gross$belbezig)

### Create employment variable with only three categories
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(employ3 = factor(
    case_when((belbezig >= 1 & belbezig <= 3) ~ "Employed for pay",
              ((belbezig >= 4 &
                 belbezig <= 7) |
                 belbezig == 9 |
                 belbezig == 10)  ~ "Unemployed/Retired/Disabled",
              ((belbezig == 8) |
                 (belbezig >= 11 & belbezig <= 13)) ~
                "Unpaid work, incl. housework",
              .default = NA
    ),
    levels = c(
      "Employed for pay",
      "Unpaid work, incl. housework",
      "Unemployed/Retired/Disabled"
    )
  ))
summary(df_gross$employ3)

## Personal net income
summary(df_gross$nettocat)
hist(df_gross$nettocat)
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(income = factor(
    case_when((nettocat == 0 | (is.na(nettocat))) ~ "No income/NA",
              (nettocat == 1 |
                 nettocat == 2) ~ "EUR 1000 or less",
              (nettocat == 3) ~ "EUR 1001 to EUR 1500",
              (nettocat == 4) ~ "EUR 1501 to EUR 2000",
              (nettocat == 5) ~ "EUR 2001 to EUR 2500",
              (nettocat == 6) ~ "EUR 2501 to EUR 3000",
              (nettocat >= 7 &
                 nettocat <= 12) ~ "More than EUR 3000"
    ),
    levels = c(
      "EUR 1000 or less",
      "EUR 1001 to EUR 1500",
      "EUR 1501 to EUR 2000",
      "EUR 2001 to EUR 2500",
      "EUR 2501 to EUR 3000",
      "More than EUR 3000",
      "No income/NA"
    )
  ))
summary(df_gross$income)

## Education
summary(df_gross$oplcat)
hist(df_gross$oplcat)

### Create education variable with only three categories
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(educ3 = factor(
    case_when((oplcat == 1 | oplcat == 2) ~ "Low",
              (oplcat == 3 |
                 oplcat == 4) ~ "Medium",
              (oplcat == 5 |
                 oplcat == 6) ~ "High",
              .default = NA
    ),
    levels = c("Low", "Medium", "High")
  ))
summary(df_gross$educ3)

df_gross <- df_gross %>% 
  droplevels()
```

```{r echo=FALSE}
## Do people who start the survey differ from those who do not? (Table E1)
m0 <- glm(
  net ~
    gender +
    age_groups +
    hh_size +
    urban +
    employ3 +
    income +
    educ3,
  family = binomial(link = "logit"),
  df_gross
)
summary(m0)
PseudoR2(m0, which = NULL)

### Create function to save ORs, AMEs, CIs, and p-values in a table
create_full_model_output_table <- function(model, filename) {
  # Get ORs and CIs from logistic regression
  summary_model <- summary(model)
  coeff_table <- summary_model$coefficients
  var_order <- rownames(coeff_table)  # <--- store original order
  
  p_values_or <- round(coeff_table[, "Pr(>|z|)"], 3)
  or_ci <- round(exp(cbind(OR = coef(model), confint(model))), 2)

  # Format OR (95% CI) string
  or_ci_str <- paste0(
    formatC(or_ci[, "OR"], format = "f", digits = 2),
    " (",
    formatC(or_ci[, "2.5 %"], format = "f", digits = 2),
    " – ",
    formatC(or_ci[, "97.5 %"], format = "f", digits = 2),
    ")"
  )

  # Compute AMEs
  margins_summary <- summary(margins(model))
  ame_vars <- margins_summary$factor
  ame_estimates <- round(margins_summary$AME, 2)
  ame_lower <- round(margins_summary$lower, 2)
  ame_upper <- round(margins_summary$upper, 2)
  ame_pvalues <- round(margins_summary$p, 3)

  # Format AME (95% CI) string
  ame_ci_str <- paste0(
    formatC(ame_estimates, format = "f", digits = 2),
    " (",
    formatC(ame_lower, format = "f", digits = 2),
    " – ",
    formatC(ame_upper, format = "f", digits = 2),
    ")"
  )

  # Create OR and AME tables
  df_or <- data.frame(
    Variable = var_order,
    OR_CI = or_ci_str,
    P_value_OR = p_values_or,
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE
  )

  df_ame <- data.frame(
    Variable = ame_vars,
    AME_CI = ame_ci_str,
    P_value_AME = ame_pvalues,
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE
  )

  # Merge
  result_df <- merge(df_or, df_ame, by = "Variable", all = TRUE)

  # Reorder rows to match original regression model order
  result_df <- result_df[match(var_order, result_df$Variable), ]

  # Write to CSV
  write.table(result_df, file = filename, row.names = FALSE, sep = ";")
}

create_full_model_output_table(m0, "m0.csv")

### Calculate predicted probabilities
df_gross <- df_gross %>% 
  mutate(predicted_prob = predict(m0, newdata = df_gross, type = "response"))

### Convert them to weights
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(ipw = (1/predicted_prob))

hist(df_gross$ipw, breaks = 50)
summary(df_gross$ipw)

### Stabilize weights
p_response <- mean(df_gross$net == "Yes")

df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(ipw_stab = case_when(
    net == "Yes" ~ p_response / predicted_prob,
    net == "No" ~ (1 - p_response) / (1 - predicted_prob),
      TRUE ~ NA_real_
    )
  )

hist(df_gross$ipw_stab, breaks = 50)
summary(df_gross$ipw_stab)

### Trim weights
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(ipw_trim = pmin(ipw_stab, quantile(ipw_stab, 0.99, na.rm = TRUE)))

hist(df_gross$ipw_trim, breaks = 50)
summary(df_gross$ipw_trim)

### Normalize weights
df_gross <- df_gross %>%
  mutate(ipw_norm = ipw_trim / mean(ipw_trim, na.rm = TRUE))

hist(df_gross$ipw_norm, breaks = 50)
summary(df_gross$ipw_norm)

## Rerun model M1 (Do iPhone/Android smartphone owners differ from non-owners?) with weights (Table E2)
df_net <- df_gross %>% 
  filter(net == "Yes")

m1_adj <- glm(
  smart_iphoneandroid ~
    gender +
    age_groups +
    hh_size +
    urban +
    employ3 +
    income +
    educ3 +
    privacy_fac +
    private_index +
    trust_pub_index +
    trust_priv_index +
    chronic +
    srh3 +
    bmi3 +
    lim_index +
    diff_index +
    days_mod_physical_act_num +
    days_stren_physical_act_num +
    days_walking_num +
    days_running_num +
    days_biking_num +
    outdoors +
    h_sedentary,
  family = binomial(link = "logit"),
  data = df_net,
  weights = ipw_norm
)
summary(m1_adj)
vif(m1_adj)
PseudoR2(m1_adj, which = NULL)

create_full_model_output_table(m1_adj, "m1_adj.csv")
```
